title: Understanding Ontology-Based Learning Design Meta-Language Semantics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical knowledge and learning design concepts
context.additional_context: A course focused on understanding and applying metalanguage semantics in learning design for graduate-level mathematics majors or related researchers, utilizing ontology-based modeling techniques in a smartphone environment.

learning_goals: Explain the core components and roles of learning design metalanguage.
Interpret IMS LD semantic structures using ontology-based modeling.
Implement and validate OWL-based learning design models in mobile environments.
Development of the ability to express and analyze logical relationships among instructional design elements

resources: IMS Learning Design (IMS LD) Sample Data
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
